snippet: A stunned family that had lived for so long without its father and husband is now preparing to travel to Wisconsin to collect Ranjit Singh’s body.
abstract: Stunned family of Ranjit Sikh, who died in the Sikh temple shooting in Oak Creek, Wis, is planning to travel from India to collect his body; they had not seen him for 16 years, since he moved to America to take a position at the temple; say he became a voice on the telephone, calling almost daily, a proud if absent father, promising that the family would be reunited as soon as his green card application was approved.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and SRUTHI GOTTIPATI

lead_paragraph: A stunned family that had lived for so long without its father and husband is now preparing to travel to Wisconsin to collect Ranjit Singh’s body.

headline.seo: Victim in Sikh Temple Shooting Endured Separation to Support Family
headline.main: For Victim in Sikh Temple Shooting, a Life of Separation
headline.print_headline: Shooting Victim’s Life Was One of Separation
